item.title: 19 Things NOT To Do When Building a Website
item.dc:creator: Vijay Joshi
item.description:
Here is a very useful post I found today. 19 mistakes to avoid while designing websites. Although, I am no expert on designing but I have found myself making some of these mistakes then and now. Some of my favorites from the list are:
If your website does not work in Firefox, welcome to 2007 DUMBASS.

item.title: FAQ: Specifying css page breaks after or before elements for printing
item.dc:creator: Vijay Joshi
item.description: While printing web pages you can specify the browser to insert page breaks before or after certain elements. This can be handy for printing documents like tickets, vouchers where information must be grouped and displayed on separate pages. There are 2 CSS properties which can be used to insert page breaks in HTML while printing. These [...]

item.title: 5 must have firefox addons for every web developer
item.dc:creator: Vijay Joshi
item.description:
Being a web developer there are some tools which I need and use on daily basis. Here are 5 such addons I think every web developer should install on their firefox. 1- Web developer toolbar
Home: http://chrispederick.com/work/web-developer/ Install: https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/60
This addon adds a toolbar and a menu to firefox. The toolbar contains several mini tools in it to [...]

item.title: How to dynamically load the Google Maps javascript API (On demand loading)
item.dc:creator: Vijay Joshi
item.description: Normally google maps js api is loaded at the time of page load via a script tag with src set. If map is not so major feature of your application or you want to reduce page download time, you can defer loading the javascript load it when required. This is a javascript pattern called On demand [...]

item.title: Happy New Year!
item.dc:creator: Vijay Joshi
item.description: Hi friends, I wish you all a very happy and prosperous new year with lots of happiness. I hope that the posts I publish here are useful for you and your questions are answered. This year I promise that I will try to write better posts and write more regularly. Best Wishes once again. Tweet This!Share this [...]

item.title: How to restore and backup mysql databases?
item.dc:creator: Vijay Joshi
item.description:
I forget the commands everytime I backup/restore mysql databases. For this reason I am writing them down for my reference and hopefully others will also find them useful. Suppose my database credentials are as follow:
db username: vijay db password: somepwd database: catalogue
Taking backup of database Go to the command line (not mysql command line) and fire the following command:
mysqldump [...]

item.title: How to create excel files in PHP?
item.dc:creator: Vijay Joshi
item.description:
Some time ago I found a class on phpclasses.org by Harish Chauhan which makes it incredibly easy to generate simple excel spreadsheets from PHP. I found it useful so I want to share its usgae with readers too. I also made some changes to the class for styling the rows.
Here is the process: 1- Include [...]

item.title: Getting and setting value of html elements using jQuery
item.dc:creator: Vijay Joshi
item.description: If you have started using jQuery recently and you are used to DOM methods of getting and setting values for form and html elements, this article is for you. Using jQuery can be confusing in the beginning but it is a lot easier once you get hold of it. In this post I will summarize methods [...]

item.title: New Google website translator gadget
item.dc:creator: Vijay Joshi
item.description: It was International Translation Day on 30th September and Google gifted users a new version of their website translator gadget. From usability point of view this version is far more better then previous one and supports 51 languages. Earlier version of this gadget was a bit ugly in the manner it worked. It used to load [...]
